For a star i don't really know cause i doesn't test yet, but for a dwarf star you can use the minmus template, apply it a star texture with a huge dump map and improve it with a colored "cloud" layer.

I made this for example :
Don't know if I should post this, but I'm streaming me working on my planet pack, here. http://www.twitch.tv/cooly568
Hell's Blazes! It's here!

I'm guessing this wasn't supposed to happen. The second image is the scaled space, the first image is the actual map. EDIT:upon reloading the game, the lander in orbit was put on a suborbital trajectory to Plantar, and the crazy scaled space view became a perfect sphere (albiet still with the crazy spiky terrain.

For the export issue. Modify (or add if it doesnt have one) a ScaledExport section to the CFG.

ScaledExport
{
	templateName=Minmus //Name of the planets template.
	mapWidth=2048  //Size of exported Texture.
	maxHeight=20000  //Highest point on the planet.
}

Change templateName to be the same as in the PFBody section.

How would I make a gas giant/planet? When I set everything up and make the template Jool and load the game it is just a copy of Jool.

You only need a _map file that is the same as the name of the planet. MyGasGiant_map.png

For a star i don't really know cause i doesn't test yet, but for a dwarf star you can use the minmus template, apply it a star texture with a huge dump map and improve it with a colored "cloud" layer.

I made this for example :

Very pretty!

Very pretty!

Thanks Kragrathea, i'm a graphic designer so, i can made some not so bad job in texturing, that's help a little

But it's nothing compare to your mod, it's just fantastic

I hope you work always on it cause i'm sure it will become the best ksp mod ever if you keep that way

thanks again

Hey, krag. When i export a texture from space engine, will there be water?? And i am going to ask- how to specify, EXACTLY hwere i want to there be a mountain or something like that?

Edited January 21, 2014 by cziken20
And how do i apply science reports etc.?

Hey, krag. When i export a texture from space engine, will there be water?? And i am going to ask- how to specify, EXACTLY hwere i want to there be a mountain or something like that?

It's the height map which tell where is the bump map before you create the .bin with the create scale function.

For a planet you need before export the scale : planet_color.png (for the color of the ground) planet_map (for the color of the planet when you're in the planetarium) planet_height.png (which generate the bump map : planet_normal.png)

That's really easy

Hey, krag. When i export a texture from space engine, will there be water?? And i am going to ask- how to specify, EXACTLY hwere i want to there be a mountain or something like that?

No. All you need from SE is the Color and Elevation map:

Make sure you export PNG files and then rename them as follows:

surface_bump.png becomes <planetname>_height.png

surface_diff.png becomes <planetname>_color.png

Add a mountain by modifying the bump map or use PQS_MapDecal in the CFG. See Skelton for an example.

Krag

Edited January 22, 2014 by Kragrathea

I don't usually post on the forums, but here goes.

I made a new system, with a certain planet I'm particularly fond of: Titus. It's got such a thick atmosphere you can't see down to the ground!

Did this by screwing around with the scaled. Once you go below the cloud layer the surface appears:

The planet's one big dune sea for the most part, the pressure is about 5 atm at average ground level. Sea level is around 8, but you'll have to land in a canyon for that.

Another planet I'm experimenting with is Enicing, a tidally locked planet that's frozen on the shadow side and has warm oceans on the light side.

Ocean and islands still look a little weird.

Also Krag, I can't get my gas giant's texture to work. I have only a _map file assigned to it like you said, but creating scaled and etc does nothing.

I get this error when it loads:

Edited January 22, 2014 by Kravity
typo

Having a little problem were i do a scaled export and the planet is working fine then restart game and then its the template planet with default on it export scaled again looks and works fine restart same thing

When .bin and bump map are created by the mod, it add an underscore to the name's file.

It's a security done by krag for non overwriting existing files.

So you just must remove it and you're ok

The zone of doom would be an area around Barry that warps space- as per a black hole- and would destroy any ship that got within 10,000km of the surface.

Also it might be a good idea to put the opposite sort of effect around it as the stars- a dark cloud or something like that.
